text: [Music]
when you consume too much sugar in your
diet the sugar is absorbed from the
intestine goes through the portal
circulation straight to the liver the
liver is the only organ that can
metabolize that molecule fructose the
fructose overwhelms the livers capacity
to be able to metabolize it and the
liver has no choice but to take the
excess and turn it into liver fat and we
now have the data that shows that when
the liver turns what it's being exposed
to into liver fat that is the signal
driver of insulin resistance that's what
drives heart disease that's what drives
fatty liver disease and ultimately
that's what drives this phenomenon
called metabolic syndrome that is type 2
diabetes hypertension lipid problems
cardiovascular disease cancer or
dementia about 40% of the normal waist
population manifest with one of the
diseases of metabolic syndrome about 80%
of the obese population manifests those
same diseases so if you do the math on
that that works out to more than half
the u.s. adult population and we've also
shown that it's true in about 1/4 of the
pediatric population as well
[Music]
